explanation:
code_hardening: none
resolve_compilation_errors: Reused existing constants (ONE_SECOND, ONE_MINUTE, ONE_HOUR, ONE_DAY) defined in TimeUtils to ensure the function compiles without introducing new fields or imports.
exception_handling: none
logic_customization: Added early returns to humanize short durations (<5 seconds → "a few seconds", <1 minute → "a moment"). Removed all seconds-related computation and output, eliminated the "and" conjunction, and preserved the original day/hour/minute breakdown logic and arithmetic.
refactoring: Replaced StringBuffer with StringBuilder, simplified string-building logic after removing seconds, and streamlined comma insertion to only occur between days, hours, and minutes.
misc: Updated return strings to match the new human-readable phrasing and adjusted formatting rules to use commas only, reflecting the absence of seconds. No new custom API calls were introduced.
